column4: I'm following this: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SSHHowto#Running%20GUI%20Programs
in putty I typed that command
oh
in that case, how do I do it from putty?
raboo: no =/
raylu*
can't use text-based
already tried those
see I screwed up my router and I've been trying to get in to fix it
but my router apparently outputs bad HTML that the text-based browsers won't display properly
ssh tcp port tunneling
ssh port forwarding, either directly to router:80 or set up a vnc server and port forward to that, connect, and start firefox.
ssh port forwarding? how can I do that?
what client do you use to ssh?
Putty configuration -> Connection -> SSH -> Tunnels
source port is port on local machine, destination is ip:port
so source 8080, then destination router_ip:80 - then connect to localhost:8080
some web interfaces does "clever stuff" that break the forwarding (hard code url in links for example), and then you'll need to use vnc instad.
so once I log in through ssh I can open a browser on my local machine and point it to localhost:8080?
yes, if port tunnel is set up correctly :)
It worked!!!
good :) and remember that ssh port tunneling is a very useful tool, for a lot of stuff :D
as a bonus it's encrypted, so no snooping on the stream too. You can even make it work as a socks proxy. It's all kinds of awesome, and one of the reasons for why ssh is my #1 favorite tool
